TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed GregorianCalendarTypes extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the different language versions of the Gregorian calendar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The date and time patterns associated with the <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> vary depending on the language. If the <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> is selected in <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Calendar%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, GregorianCalendarTypes can be used to specify which date and time patterns to use in that <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo>.
For Arabic cultures, more language versions of the Gregorian calendar are available. For example, you can use the French version of <xref:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar> using the F:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes.MiddleEastFrench?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True value.
A culture that supports T:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True might not support all language versions of T:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. The P:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Calendar?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True and P:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.OptionalCalendars?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True properties specify the calendars supported by that culture. If T:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is supported, P:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar.CalendarType?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True can be used to determine which language versions of T:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True are supported.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to determine the GregorianCalendar language version supported by the culture.
[!CODE [System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes#1)]
The following code example prints a T:System.DateTime?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True using a T:System.Globalization.GregorianCalendar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True that is localized.
[!CODE [System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.GregorianCalendarLocalized#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes Arabic = int32(10)

Docs.summary: Refers to the Arabic version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes Localized = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Refers to the localized version of the Gregorian calendar, based on the language of the T:System.Globalization.CultureInfo?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True that uses the T:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes MiddleEastFrench = int32(9)

Docs.summary: Refers to the Middle East French version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes TransliteratedEnglish = int32(11)

Docs.summary: Refers to the transliterated English version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes TransliteratedFrench = int32(12)

Docs.summary: Refers to the transliterated French version of the Gregorian calendar.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Globalization.GregorianCalendarTypes USEnglish = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Refers to the U.S. English version of the Gregorian calendar.
